intro: Pityrodia pungens, commonly known as the roughleaf daphne, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, pungent-smelling flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, hairy leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink to purple. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Pityrodia pungens is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
